intro: Pterocephalus glandulosissimus, commonly known as the woolly globe-thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, woolly gray foliage and spherical, spiky flower heads that resemble small globes. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, yellowish-green composite flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and at high altitudes. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
